result.execSummary:
The defendant Sylvia A Sellenheim #510990509 was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.21(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court witheld sentence. If defendant is revoked, credit for -0- days served and no Huber privileges.

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid. Pay supervision fees.

No contact with firearms.
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
Defendant to have no contact with the child/ren without permission of the court.

Attend parenting classes.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

timeConds.notes: With work and child care release.  Defendant to report on 09/11/2015.

charges.descr: Neglecting a Child (Consequence is Bodily Harm)

Defendant Sylvia A Sellenheim in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
 Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  Additional statement by:  Lauren S.
Court withheld sentence. Defendant has credit for -0- days served.  No huber priviles.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 3 years with the following conditions:
- Defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction with work and child care release.   Defendant to report on 09/11/2015.
- Attend parenting classes.
- Defendant to have no contact with the child/ren without permission of the court.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.

 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Sylvia A Sellenheim in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case set for Jury Trial. Parties have reached a resolution in this matter. Case called with co-defendant Joseph Muns, 15CF423.
AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Court advised that under 48 USC Section 922(g)(9) the defendant is prohibited from possession of a firearm and/or ammunition after conviction of a misdemeanor crime of domestic violence. Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. Case adjourned to branch 36 for Sentencing.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for September 4, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Motion In Limine.
Received & Filed, Defendant's Witness List.
Received & Filed, Demand for Discovery and Inspection.
Received & Filed, State's Motion In Limine & State's Witness List. (Filed in Case 15CF423)

Defendant Sylvia A Sellenheim in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Final Pretrial held. Parties ready to proceed to trial, all conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned to branch 23 for Jury Trial at 8:30 am on 07/20/2015.

Defendant Sylvia A Sellenheim in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer. Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. State's offer is open until date of Final Pretrial. All motions to be filed, and discovery turned over 20 DAYS in advance of Jury Trial.  All conditions of bail remain in effect. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 23.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sylvia A Sellenheim in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for Preliminary Hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver, received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial before Judge Grady, Branch 23. Original Information, received and filed. Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defendant plead not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned to Branch 23.  Status conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff: 01/23/2015
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with BP; LS; and DJS.
Court ordered any bail posted to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Sylvia A Sellenheim in court with attorney Terese M. Dick.  Zachary A. Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23. 
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch 23.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 1/26/15 @ 1:30pm
